item.title: NASA Administrator Discusses Collaboration with US Space Force
item.itunes:author: Erie Looking Productions
item.itunes:subtitle: The Contingencies Show: NASA Administrator Discusses Collaboration with US Space Force
item.itunes:summary: The Mitchell Institute hosted the Space Power Forum with NASA Administrator Jim Bridenstine and Chief of Space Operations General Jay Raymond on Tuesday, September 22. The space domain is as vitally important to U.S. defense as it is to its scientific and commercial interests, and the establishment of the U.S. Space Force (USSF) raises big questions with implications for all. This conversation with the leaders of NASA and the USSF explored how they intend to collaboratively tackle shared challenges in space, their respective mission requirements, and opportunities to leverage commercial capabilities and innovation.
item.description: The Mitchell Institute hosted the Space Power Forum with NASA Administrator Jim Bridenstine and Chief of Space Operations General Jay Raymond on Tuesday, September 22. The space domain is as vitally important to U.S. defense as it is to its scientific and commercial interests, and the establishment of the U.S. Space Force (USSF) raises big questions with implications for all. This conversation with the leaders of NASA and the USSF explored how they intend to collaboratively tackle shared challenges in space, their respective mission requirements, and opportunities to leverage commercial capabilities and innovation. The Mitchell Institute hosted the Space Power Forum with NASA Administrator Jim Bridenstine and Chief of Space Operations General Jay Raymond on Tuesday, September 22. The space domain is as vitally important to U.S. defense as it is to its scientific and commercial interests, and the establishment of the U.S. Space Force (USSF) raises big questions with implications for all. This conversation with the leaders of NASA and the USSF explored how they intend to collaboratively tackle shared challenges in space, their respective mission requirements, and opportunities to leverage commercial capabilities and innovation. Show Notes Available at http://coyote.works/podcast/2021/NASA-USSF.html.

item.title: Beach Girls and the Monster
item.itunes:author: Erie Looking Productions
item.itunes:subtitle: The Contingencies Show: Beach Girls and the Monster
item.itunes:summary: A 1960s horror film is not really a horror film but rather a bikini girl flick with a monster on the side. It is definitely a weird one. Is the monster real or is something else happening?
item.description: A 1960s horror film is not really a horror film but rather a bikini girl flick with a monster on the side. It is definitely a weird one.
